IO Factory¶

class IOFactory.IOFactory[source]¶

Class for loading and saving point clouds or rasters from files

Creates PointSet from: .pts, .xyz

Creates RasterData from: .asc, .txt

Write PointSet Data to different types of file: .pts(TODO), .xyz(TODO), shapeFile

Methods

classmethod GetCurvatureFilePath(folderPath, dataName, currentFileIndex, localNeighborhoodParameters, decimationRadius, testRun)[source]¶

Gets the curvature files according to path

Parameters

  • folderPath (str) – Path to curvature-files folder

  • dataName (str) – name of the new file

  • currentFileIndex (int) – indexing for saving (file1.txt, file2.txt, etc)

  • localNeighborhoodParameters (dict) – dictionary holding the neighborhood parameters (radius and maximum number of neighbors)

  • decimationRadius (float) – minimal distance between two points for downsampling .

  • testRun (bool) – If true then only temporary files will be saved that are cleaned at each run.

TODO

Elia – please provide better explanation

Returns

full filename and path for loading (or saving) curvature files

Return type

str

classmethod ReadHDF(f, classname, **kwargs)[source]¶
classmethod ReadLAS(fileName, classification_flag=False)[source]¶

Reads LAS or LAZ file. Can return classification property in addition to the point cloud

Parameters

  • fileName (str) – path to file (LAS or LAZ)

  • classification_flag (bool) – a flag whether to return a classification property or not (default: False)

Returns

pointcloud, classification

Return type

PointSet, ClassificationProperty

classmethod ReadPickle(fileobj, classname)[source]¶

Reads any pickle and assigns it according to given class.

Parameters

  • fileobj (file) – the filename

  • classname (type) – the class to assign the pickle to

Returns

the object loaded from the pickle

Return type

BaseData or BaseProperty

classmethod ReadPts(filename, pointsetlist=None, colorslist=None, merge=True)[source]¶

Reading points from .pts file. If the pts file holds more than one PointSet merge into one PointSet (unless told otherwise).

Parameters

fileName – name of .pts file

Optionals

Parameters

  • pointsetlist (list) – placeholder for created PointSet objects

  • colorslist (list) – placeholder for ColorProperty for PointSet object(s)

  • merge (bool) – merge points in file into one PointSet or not. Default: True.

Returns

The created PointSet or the list of the PointSets created and the ColorProperty that belongs to it

Return type

PointSet

classmethod ReadPtx(filename, pointsetlist=None, colorslist=None, trasformationMatrices=None, remove_empty=True)[source]¶

Reads .ptx file, created by Leica Cyclone

File is built according to: https://w3.leica-geosystems.com/kb/?guid=5532D590-114C-43CD-A55F-FE79E5937CB2

Parameters

filename – path to file + file

Optionals

Parameters

  • pointsetlist (list) – list that holds all the uploaded PointSet

  • colorslist (list) – list that holds all the color properties that relate to the PointSet

  • transformationMatrices – list that holds all the transformation properties that relate to the PointSet

Returns

pointSet list

Return type

list

Warning

Doesn’t read the transformation matrices.

classmethod ReadShapeFile(fileName, pointSetList)[source]¶

Importing points from shapefiles

Parameters

  • fileName (str) – Full path and name of the shapefile to be created (not including the extension)

  • pointSetList (list) – place holder for created PointSet objects

classmethod ReadXYZ(fileName, pointsetlist=None, merge=True)[source]¶

Reading points from .xyz file Creates one PointSet objects returned through pointSetList

Parameters

  • fileName (str) – name of .xyz file

  • pointsetlist (list) – place holder for created PointSet object

Returns

Number of PointSet objects created

Return type

int

classmethod WriteToPts(points, path)[source]¶

Write to pts file

param points

PointSet

param path

to the directory of a new file + file name

classmethod WriteToShapeFile(pointSet, fileName, colors=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Exporting points to shapefile

Parameters

  • pointSet (PointSet or PointSubSet) – A PointSetPointSubSet object with the points to be extracted

  • fileName (str) – Full path and name of the shapefile to be created (not including the extension)

  • kwargs – Additional properties can be sent using kwargs which will be added as attributes in the shapfile

  • colors (ColorProperty) – ColorProperty object with the points colors

Returns

static curve2shp(curves, filename)[source]¶

TODO: make function Turn curves to shapefiles

Parameters

  • curves – curves as represented by matplotlib.plot

  • filename – file to save the curve

Warning

Empty function.

Returns

classmethod load(filename, classname=None, pointsetlist=None, colorlist=None, merge=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Loads an object file (json or hdf5)

Warning

The option is not implemented for json

Parameters

  • filename (str) – the path

  • classname (type) – the property or data class that the filename stores

  • pointsetlist (list) – a list to store pointset list if more than one cloud is in the file (applicaple for pts, ptx and shapefiles)

  • colorlist (list) – a list to store colors proeprty, if colors are within the file (applicaple for pts and ptx)

  • merge (bool) – flag to merge multiple clouds into one pointset (applicaple for pts)

Returns

the property or dataset

Returns

classmethod rasterFromGDAL(path)[source]¶
classmethod read2_PointSetOpen3D(file_path, voxel_size=-1, print_bb=False)[source]¶

Reads a file into a PointSetOpen3D object

Parameters

  • file_path – Path of pointcloud file

  • voxel_size – If >0 then decimate point cloud with this parameter as min points distance

  • print_bb – Print boundarybox values

Type

str

Type

Positive double

Type

bool

Returns

pointsetExtra Object

Return type

PointSetExtra

classmethod saveDataset(dataset, filename, name='dataset')[source]¶

Save dataset according to filename extensioin.

The extension depends on the filename extension.

Parameters

  • dataset (BaseData) – the dataset to save

  • filename (str) – the filename to save the dataset to

  • name (str) – for h5 files, the name of the group

Returns

classmethod saveProperty(property_class, filename, save_dataset=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Saves a property to hdf5 or json file

Default: hdf5

Warning

Json file save is unavailable

Parameters

  • file – path or file object

  • property_class (BaseProperty or subclasses) – the property which is needed to be saved

  • save_dataset (bool) – flag whether to save the dataset that the property relates to or not. Default: True

Returns

Reading Functions¶

Specific functions for file reading. Called from the IOFactory

ReadFunctions.GetCurvatureFilePath(folderPath, dataName, currentFileIndex, localNeighborhoodParameters, decimationRadius, testRun)[source]¶

Gets the curvature files according to path

Parameters

  • folderPath (str) – Path to curvature-files folder

  • dataName (str) – name of the new file

  • currentFileIndex (int) – indexing for saving (file1.txt, file2.txt, etc)

  • localNeighborhoodParameters (dict) – dictionary holding the neighborhood parameters (radius and maximum number of neighbors)

  • decimationRadius (float) – minimal distance between two points for downsampling .

  • testRun (bool) – If true then only temporary files will be saved that are cleaned at each run.

Returns

full filename and path for loading (or saving) curvature files

Return type

ReadFunctions.ReadLAS(filename, classification=False)[source]¶

Reads LAS or LAZ files

Parameters

  • filename (str) – path to LAS or LAZ

  • classification (bool) – return a SegmentationProperty according to the LAS file or not (default: False)

Returns

pointcloud, (classification as received from LAS file)

Return type

PointSet, SegmentationProperty

ReadFunctions.ReadPts(filename, pointsetlist=None, colorslist=None, merge=True)[source]¶

Reading points from .pts file. If the pts file holds more than one PointSet merge into one PointSet (unless told otherwise).

Parameters

fileName – name of .pts file

Optionals :param pointsetlist: placeholder for created PointSet objects :param colorslist: placeholder for ColorProperty for PointSet object(s)

Parameters

merge (bool) – merge points in file into one PointSet or not. Default: True.

Returns

The created PointSet or the list of the PointSets

Return type

PointSet or list

ReadFunctions.ReadPtx(filename, pointsetlist=[], colorslist=[], trasformationMatrices=[], remove_empty=True)[source]¶

Reads .ptx file, created by Leica Cyclone

File is build according to: https://w3.leica-geosystems.com/kb/?guid=5532D590-114C-43CD-A55F-FE79E5937CB2

Parameters

filename – path to file + file

Optionals

Parameters

  • pointsetlist (list) – list that holds all the uploaded PointSet

  • colorslist (list of ColorProperty) – list that holds all the color properties that relate to the PointSet

  • transformationMatrices – list that holds all the transformation properties that relate to the PointSet

  • removeEmpty (bool) – flag to remove or leave empty points. Default: True

Returns

pointSet list

Return type

list

Warning

Doesn’t read the transformation matrices.

ReadFunctions.ReadXYZ(fileName, pointsetlist=[], merge=True)[source]¶

Reading points from .xyz file Creates one PointSet objects returned through pointSetList

Parameters

  • fileName (str) – name of .xyz file

  • pointsetlist (list) – place holder for created PointSet object

Returns

Number of PointSet objects created

Return type

int

ReadFunctions.loadPickle_dataset(filename, type=None)[source]¶

Loads a pickle file of a dataset.

The user can specify which type of data it is .

Parameters

  • filename (str) – file and path to file

  • type (class) – the type of class (BallTreePointSet, PointSet, PointSubSet, etc.)

Returns

BaseData

SaveFunctions.WriteToShapeFile(pointSet, fileName, colors=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Exporting points to shapefile

Parameters

  • pointSet (PointSet or PointSubSet) – A PointSetPointSubSet object with the points to be extracted

  • fileName (str) – Full path and name of the shapefile to be created (not including the extension)

  • kwargs – Additional properties can be sent using kwargs which will be added as attributes in the shapfile

  • colors (ColorProperty) – ColorProperty object with the points colors

Returns

SaveFunctions.pickleDataset(dataset, path_or_buf, **kwargs)[source]¶

Save the PointSet in either json or hdf5.

Default is hdf5.

Warning

Need to be implemented for json

Parameters

  • dataset (BaseData or subclass) – the dataset to save

  • path_or_buf (str or h5py.File or file) – the path (string) or file object

  • extension (str) – ‘h5’ or ‘p’ or ‘pickle’

:return the file after saving :rtype: file

SaveFunctions.pickleProperty(property, fileobj, save_dataset=False)[source]¶

Saves a property to a filename

Parameters

  • property (BaseProperty) – The property to save

  • fileobj (file) – The filename to which the property will be saved

  • save_dataset (bool) – flag whether to save the dataset that the property relates to or not. Default: False

Returns

success of failure

Return type

bool

Warning

Does not work for properties that hold PointSetOpen3D

SaveFunctions.save_dataset_h5(dataset, h5file, name='dataset', save_dataset=False)[source]¶
Parameters

  • dataset (BaseData) – dataset to save

  • h5file (h5py.File) – file object of hdf5

  • name (str) – name of the group for the dataset (default: ‘dataset’)

  • save_dataset (bool) – flag whether to save the dataset that the property relates to or not. Default: False

SaveFunctions.save_property_h5(property, h5file, save_dataset=False)[source]¶

Save property to hdf5

Parameters

  • property (BaseProperty) – the proeprty to save

  • h5file (h5py.file) – file object of hdf5

  • save_dataset (bool) – flag whether to save the dataset that the property relates to or not. Default: False
